revision.text: Threshold cycle (or Ct or Cq) is a count which is defined as the fractional PCR cycle number at which the reporter fluorescence is greater than the threshold in the context of the RT-qPCR assay. The Ct is a basic principle of real time PCR and is an essential component in producing accurate and reproducible data. Alejandra Gonzalez-Beltran Orlaith Burke Philippe Rocca-Serra Cq Ct http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/probe/doc/TechQPCR.shtml is a subclass from number of PCR cycle
